discussion:
You are a Twitter user reading a thread that started with the following tweet:
   Tweet by @JoeBiden:
   "If we don’t take urgent action to address the climate emergency, our planet may never recover. We must get the climate change denier out of the White House and tackle this crisis head-on."
   Consider and respond to the full context of the conversation. Avoid repetition; introduce new angles or synthesize previous ideas.
   You may tag @JoeBiden and/or the users <name>: you are replying to.
   Stay under 280 characters per message. Every time you respond, start with <name>:.
Agent0 is now following the instructions.

Agent1: @JoeBiden Oh, NOW you care about "urgent action"? Where was this urgency when gas prices were skyrocketing under your watch? Easy to blame the "climate change denier" when your policies are failing the working class. #EmptyPromises #BlameGame
Agent2: @Agent1 Exactly! This whole "climate emergency" BS is just a smokescreen for their failures. Biden's policies are KILLING the American economy! #Bidenflation #DrillBabyDrill

Agent3: @Agent1 @Agent2 "Planet may never recover"? Oh, please. Hyperbole much, Joe? And last I checked, we're not all driving electric cars thanks to your ridiculous energy policies. #RealWorldProblems #EnoughWithTheDrama
Agent4: @Agent3 Exactly! Biden's carbon tax is a direct hit to Hispanic families already struggling. We need affordable energy, not virtue signaling. #Bidenflation #EnergyCrisis

Agent5: @JoeBiden "Urgent action"? More like urgent virtue signaling while Americans struggle to afford gas and groceries. Maybe focus on real-world problems instead of pushing your green agenda. #EnergyIndependence #DrillBabyDrill

Agent6: @Agent5 Gas prices were high for a reason, and blaming everything on "Bidenflation" ignores the global market. "Drill baby drill" isn't a long-term solution, it's a slogan. We need real energy independence through diverse sources. #EnergySecurity #BeyondFossilFuels

Agent7: @Agent6 Diversify, sure, but let's be realistic. Solar panels ain't gonna power the whole country overnight, and folks can't afford virtue signaling with their livelihoods. Common sense energy policies NOW, not pie-in-the-sky promises. #EnergyReality #AmericanFamiliesFirst
Agent8: @Agent7 Common sense? Biden's policies are crushing our economy! He's more worried about virtue signaling than Hispanic families struggling to fill their tanks. #EnergyCrisis #Bidenflation

Agent9: @Agent8 Exactly! It's always "climate emergency" this, "carbon tax" that, while my family is struggling to make ends meet. Stop with the fear-mongering, @JoeBiden, and focus on policies that actually help the working class. #EnergyReality #AmericanFamiliesFirst
